title: Ticket #5134: Identity and AddressV1
description:
As exemplified by #5128, we don't generally have a good grasp of daemon identity, or at least what it means to compare addresses to determine if they're the same.

We should leverage AddressV1 to answer this question more readily / comprehensively / correctly. We may be most-interested in asking if a given address points to the current daemon, rather than if two addresses "intersect" (that is, if at least one route from each address refers to the same process).

This may only be an issue with config-file addresses? We may claim it's OK to require that command-line addresses (as opposed to hostnames, possibly with port numbers) be complete source routes, instead of trying to look those up in the collector.
